State-owned natural gas distributor Gail (India) Ltd., low-cost airline SpiceJet Ltd., Adani Power Ltd. and Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. are among companies reporting their April-June quarter results on Wednesday.Gail (India) is expected to see profit quadruple sequentially to Rs 1,043 crore on account of a low base, Bloomberg consensus estimate shows. The company had accounted for a Rs 788 crore impairment charge in the previous quarter. Revenue may fall 3 percent to Rs 13,061 crore. Operating income is seen growing 12 percent to Rs 1,747 crore quarter-on-quarter.
















What To WatchProfitability in its LPG business and petrochemicals businessPending tariff revisions for key pipelines






SpiceJet may see a 20 percent profit growth due to a rise in the passenger load factor. Revenue is likely to increase 17 percent on a year-on-year basis to Rs 1,788 crore. Operating margin may contract 400 basis points to 26 percent.
















What To WatchVolume growth and yieldsFuel price guidanceGrowth in passenger numbersCommentary on cash flow management






Adani Power's loss may widen further to Rs 832 crore from Rs 31.2 crore in the same quarter last year, according to Bloomberg consensus estimates. Operating income is estimated to decline 31 percent to Rs 1,322 crore while the margin may contract due to increase in raw material prices.
















What To WatchSteady demand seen in April and MayJune sales to be impacted because of destocking at dealer levelCompany reported highest ever EBITDA margin in the base quarterMargin to be impacted due to increase in raw material expensesOther Results
